image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks outdoors.

props.synopsis: China's state iron ore buyer has ordered steelmakers to pause purchases of iron ore shipments from BHP, according to media reports, as they continue hardball negotiations with the company.

title.children: Albanese 'concerned' by reports of Chinese ban on BHP iron ore imports

image.altText: A white building with towering columns and a domed roof.

props.synopsis: The US is on the brink of its first government shutdown in more than six years as politicians duel over federal funding. Here's what that means.

title.children: US on the cusp of a government shutdown

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Chris Minns Jacinta Allan, prime minister in focus.

props.synopsis: States and territory governments have accused the federal government of walking away from a deal struck in 2023 to fund public hospitals. Follow live.

title.children: States clash with federal government over health funding deal

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: States accuse federal government of walking away from health funding deal
Expansion of first home buyer scheme will open it up to billionaires, Coalition says
PM responds to reports China's blocked BHP iron ore

image.altText: The terrain near Yunta.

props.synopsis: The search for a four-year-old boy who remains missing in South Australia's north days after he disappeared is shifting towards a "recovery" phase despite the discovery of a footprint, police have said.

title.children: Footprint found but search for missing boy moving to 'recovery' phase

image.altText: An umpire bounces a ball before an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The AFL will no longer have the traditional bouncedown to start men's games, and has also ditched the controversial sub rule.

title.children: After more than a century, the centre bounce is no more in the AFL

image.altText: Bruce Beresford, Susie Porter and Bryan Brown all dressed formally standing on the red carpet at a premiere.

props.synopsis: Renowned Australian director and screenwriter Bruce Beresford says US President Donald Trump's plan to impose a 100 per cent tariff on all foreign-made movies cannot be done.

title.children: Hollywood veteran slams Trump's plans to impose 100pc tariff on movies made outside US

image.altText: A white plane wing with  red tip

props.synopsis: The closure of the three bases will take effect in 2026 and affect about 70 personnel, who will be supported throughout the process, the airline said.

title.children: Qantas to close staff bases in Canberra, Hobart and Mildura

image.altText: A firefighter battles a bushfire at night.

props.synopsis: An area of southern Queensland larger than Tasmania is under a total fire ban that will be extended from central Queensland to the Gold Coast from Thursday.

title.children: Total fire ban in place for massive area of Queensland

image.altText: A surfer balancing on a board on a wave.

props.synopsis: The disastrous algal bloom that has been, for at least six months, lapping at South Australia's shores has turned a coastline into a frontline. It's left many swimmers, surfers and seaside business operators wondering what the upcoming summer will look like.

title.children: The sea is sick and has entered uncharted waters

image.altText: A large brown coloured factory positioned on a river with the view of a mountain behind it.

props.synopsis: Hobart suburbs bordering a zinc smelter and a mining town in north-west Tasmania will undergo human health risk monitoring for lead deposit rates, the state's environment protection watchdog has announced.

title.children: Lead dust monitoring in Hobart suburbs near zinc smelter, Rosebery mine to start, EPA says

image.altText: Skid marks and upturned dirt on a grassy plain.

props.synopsis: Members of the Aboriginal community are reeling after vandals allegedly performed donuts at Wybalenna on Flinders Island.

title.children: Vandalism at sacred Aboriginal site 'devastating' and 'painful'

image.altText: Light shines on rubble of a shrine damaged in an earthquake.

props.synopsis: The quake, which struck the central Cebu province, injured many others and sent residents scrambling out of their homes and into the darkness as the intense shaking cut off power.

title.children: At least 69 dead after powerful Philippines quake

image.altText: A close-up of Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: This year's Boyer Lectures will consider whether our democratic system will hold in the face of global headwinds.

title.children: Will Australia's democracy survive global collapse?

image.altText: Keith Urban and Nicole Kidman smiling for the cameras

props.synopsis: The recent split of much-loved Aussie couple Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban has left the world in shock. Here's a look back on their nearly two-decade relationship.

title.children: 'She's the one': A look back at Kidman and Urban's relationship after separation

image.altText: A large brown bear stands in the river below a waterfall.

props.synopsis: A hunky brown bear named 32 Chunk has waddled away with the Fat Bear Week title for 2025.

title.children: Fat Bear Week title awarded to male who overcame potentially fatal injury

image.altText: LP24-DEC29-@GXBRIELLEMXRY-LolaYoung-1

props.synopsis: The 24-year-old shared a statement on Instagram on October 1, saying that she will be "going away for a while" to work on herself and "come back stronger".

title.children: Lola Young cancels 'everything' to focus on health after onstage collapse

image.altText: A woman holds a glass wine bottle and aluminum bottle side by side

props.synopsis: A Victorian company releases Australia's first aluminium wine bottles to reduce its carbon footprint, while acknowledging drinkers may take some convincing.

title.children: Are aluminium wine bottles the future for Australian drinkers?

image.altText: The headshots of two men in suits are side-by-side in the same image.

props.synopsis: Australia and Türkiye are at loggerheads over who will host the massive international event, with insiders suggesting the countries could share the hosting rights.

title.children: Australia and Türkiye hit impasse over global climate summit

image.altText: A large power station with three towers, the sky is blue behind the structure.

props.synopsis: Rio Tinto tells workers the Gladstone Power Station could retire six years earlier than expected.

title.children: Rio Tinto flags early retirement of Queensland's largest coal-fired power station

image.altText: A close up of a middle aged woman with a worried expression, looking up and to her left.

props.synopsis: With Hamas yet to provide its response to Donald Trump's peace plan, affected civilians on both sides of the war share their concerns and hopes for the future.

title.children: Israeli hostage families and Palestinians in nervous wait over Gaza peace plan

image.altText: Pete Hegseth

props.synopsis: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth summoned hundreds of US military officials to an in-person meeting to declare an end to "woke" culture in the military.

title.children: Hegseth slams 'fat generals' and diversity initiatives in US military

image.altText: An elderly man and woman hugging, standing next to each other in their backyard garden.

props.synopsis: Men with aggressive prostate cancer who were being treated with a groundbreaking drug have been told the therapy is no longer available at public hospitals.

title.children: Cancer patients told treatment no longer available at public hospitals

image.altText: Napheesa Collier and Caitlin Clark sit and smile at NBA All Star weekend.

props.synopsis: WNBA superstar Napheesa Collier goes scorched earth on the league's leadership, criticising a lack of accountability and revealing some alarming comments by commissioner Cathy Engelbert.

title.children: WNBA boss allegedly says Caitlin Clark should be 'grateful' despite $78k salary

image.altText: an illustration showing a young person sitting against a wall on a skateboard, with court symbols

props.synopsis: The ABC spent a week inside the court that presides over youth crime and witnessed fearful victims, young people living with trauma and magistrates facing the difficult to decision to bail or remand.

title.children: 'I don't want to see you again': A week inside a children's court

image.altText: Three photos of Sergeant Morey with his hands around Sean Beasley's neck.

props.synopsis: A man who alleges he was choked by an off-duty police officer in front of his daughter says he has lost trust in the police force, after they found "insufficient evidence" to lay charges over the road incident.

title.children: Perth dad reveals details of alleged choking by off-duty police officer

image.altText: A man holding a firearm smiling and wearing ear muffs

props.synopsis: A gun enthusiast who rang a WA Police acting inspector who was involved in the state's firearm reforms and told him "we're coming for you" three times is ordered to do community work and undergo counselling.

title.children: Army reservist avoids jail for threatening police officer over WA gun laws

image.altText: A woman with light skin applies sunscreen to her shoulder.

props.synopsis: Ten further sunscreens have either been pulled from shelves or "paused" from supply to retailers over concerns about their sun protection claims, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) announces.

title.children: Ten more sunscreens removed from sale over SPF concerns

image.altText: A woman looks at the myTax website on a computer screen, resting her head on her hand.

props.synopsis: The 2024/25 tax deadline is fast approaching, and missing the cut-off date could end up costing you. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Haven't done your tax return yet? You have one month left

image.altText: Red rock with various animals etched in including camels and goats, highlighted with blue tracing.

props.synopsis: Three newly discovered sites filled with art and stone tools have pushed back the date on when humans returned to Arabia after the last ice age.

title.children: Mystery artists carved life-sized camels into rocks 12,000 years ago

image.altText: Minister Anika Wells wearing a grey jacket and white blouse speaking at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Touted in some insider circles as future Labor leadership material, self-identified millennial Anika Wells finds herself in a storm over the nation's emergency triple-0 system.

title.children: Optus crisis opens a political vulnerability for Coalition to seize upon

image.altText: Roslyn Grima sits in the sun outside her home. A dachshund lays at her feet.

props.synopsis: A court has granted Roslyn Grima the right to list her caravan park home on the market, but whether she can legally make a sale remains in dispute.

title.children: Caravan park resident with months to live can list her home for sale, court rules

image.altText: Jeff Schoep sitting in Chesterfield chair.

props.synopsis: Former US Neo-Nazi leader Jeff Schoep urges the Australian media not to publicise the actions of Neo-Nazis, after attending protests to gain insights into extremism in Victoria.

title.children: American ex-Neo-Nazi takes 'peace building' mission to Victoria

image.altText: Afghan girls attend a religious studies class dressed in traditional black robes.

props.synopsis: Internet and mobile services have been cut across the country, a move human rights groups say will severely impact women and girls in particular.

title.children: Women and girls severely impacted by telecom blackout in Afghanistan

image.altText: Vanessa Low leaps into the sand in the long jump at the world para athletics championships.

props.synopsis: Vanessa Low wins her fourth long jump world title as four athletes win gold for Australia at the World Para Athletics.

title.children: Low goes long for fourth gold on medal-laden night at World Para Athletics
